title: Note to the Reader
publication_title: The Lithographs of James McNeill Whistler: The Digital Edition
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">The Art Institute of Chicago is proud to issue a digital edition of our two-volume catalogue raisonné The Lithographs of James McNeill Whistler, first published in 1998. This faithful reproduction of the original necessitated select revisions to ensure a functional and legible experience for readers. Elements subject to change include typography, image placement, and chart formatting. Image callouts were added to the Whistler-Way Correspondance. Editorial choices were generally preserved; some punctuation, however, was updated to house style. Where we encountered the rare ambiguity or error, we have tried to offer corrections. Terms are updated to correspond to the glossary. Credit lines appear as published in 1998, except for works now in the Art Insitute’s collection.

This digital publication is powered by ChicagoCodeX (CCX), an open source suite of software tools which provides an authoring and publishing environment for online catalogues with full scholarly apparatuses; intuitive book-like navigation; robust presentation tools for complex, multilayered images; and personalized reader annotation tools.

The OSCI team at the Art Institute of Chicago conceived and managed the project and the development of the ChicagoCodeX, which served as the foundation of the open-sourced, digital publishing platform OSCI Toolkit (oscitoolkit.com). The project’s impetus and funding came from the Getty Foundation. The initial coding and technical implementation was researched and executed by the IMA Lab, a Web design and development consultancy of the Indianapolis Museum of Art.

We recommend using the latest version of Chrome, Safari, or Firefox.

Below are examples of how to cite the different elements of this catalogue.

Harriet K. Stratis and Martha Tedeschi, eds., The Lithographs of James McNeill Whistler: The Digital Edition, digital ed. overseen by Jay A. Clarke and Sarah Kelly Oehler, 2 vols. (1998; Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 2021), para. X.

Nicholas Smale, “Whistler’s Lithographic Techniques: Beauty and Business,” in The Lithographs of James McNeill Whistler: The Digital Edition, ed. Harriet K Stratis and Martha Tedeschi, digital ed. overseen by Jay A. Clarke and Sarah Kelly Oehler, 2 vols. (1998; Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 2021), para. X.

Click on the icon to the left of the question mark to open up a box where you can register for a free account. Logging in allows you to take notes within all Art Institute digital catalogues and even export your notes for viewing and printing.

The following conventions for dating artworks are used throughout the catalogue:

1890: if executed in 1890

c. 1890: if executed sometime around 1890

1890–93: if begun in 1890 and completed in 1893

1890/93: if executed some time during or over the period 1890–93

Credit lines appear as published in 1998, except for works in the Art Institute's collection.
